title: Access to Fountains V Information on Guardian Property Management's Website

title: Update on Fiber Internet for our Fountains V Community
text:
The board reviewed the Tillman Fiber design document and voted to approve the project at the meeting held on 10/21/25.
Tillman is preparing to begin the work in the next few weeks. The new system Go Live date is now estimated to be 01/01/2026.

title: Are you looking for a condo watcher???
text:
If you are looking for a condo watcher while you are away from our Fountains V Community, please contact Tom Dorway.

Tom’s contact information is:

Phone: 239-571-3235

title: GARBAGE/TRASH, RECYCLE
text:
Garbage/Trash:
Items that cannot be disposed of in your kitchen disposal or household trash should be placed in the dumpster.
Furniture, TVs, large items, or construction materials are prohibited in or around the dumpster.
When the West dumpster is full, please use the East dumpster.

The Collier County Landfill (a.k.a. "the dump") for disposing of larger items is located at:
3730 White Lake Blvd
Naples, Florida
Monday - Saturday 8:30 AM to 4:30 PM

Recycling:
Recyclables must be placed in the Recycle bins.
Please do not place garbage/trash, plastic bags, or any type of styrofoam in the Recycle bins.
Boxes must be broken down before being placed in the Recycle bins. NOTE: We are charged if they are not broken down.

The Naples Recycling drop-off center for recycling larger items is located at:
2640 Corporate Flight Dr.
Naples, Florida
Monday - Saturday 8:30 AM to 4:30 PM

title: PEST CONTROL
text:
If anyone has a bug problem in their unit, please call Massey Pest Control at 239-430-0708 to schedule an in-home inspection.
Massey needs 48 hours' advance notice, and Tuesday is Massey's scheduled day for the Fountains V association.
NOTE: Fountains V has a contract with Massey Pest Control.

title: BICYCLES
text:
All bicycles that are not stored inside your unit need to be tagged and registered with Fountains V.
The cost for this is $5.00.

For more information, please call:
Phil Froburg (978-502-3494)
or
John Dean (309-310-5770)

title: RECYCLE YOUR BICYCLE!
text:
The 24 Hour Club is a place where 117 recovery meetings are held each week.
They consist of AA, Alanon, Alateen, and ACA meetings held in our 3 meeting rooms and outdoor patio.
A decision was made by the Club that we would accept donations of used bicycles and give them free of charge to those in need.
These recipients are most often getting out of a rehab program and need the bikes for transportation.
It is very common for those in early recovery to have lost the ability to drive cars.
These bikes allow them to get jobs and attend recovery meetings.

While we repair those bikes that need restoration through volunteer member labor, many of the bikes need little or no work.
We have also accepted modest cash donations to replace tires and parts for small repairs.
We are fortunate enough to have a large shed on our property for the storage and repair of bikes.

We would be pleased to come pick up bikes for distribution.
This program has been hugely successful. We have distributed 135 bikes so far!
A couple of recipients have reported back that the bike they received changed their lives!

If you would like to discuss our program with us, or if you have a bike to donate, please contact:
Peter Fleming
239-877-7450
Pflemin2@gmail.com

title: Interested in renting February and/or March 2026
